O9iVmgS_hPtNd887LDBctw.review_text: Sadly, I have to downgrade my rating to just 1 star.  The service we have endured as of late has been absolutely abysmal.  They have consistently delivered the wrong orders, packed veggie sushi together side by side with regular fish sushi, and taken up to 2+ hours to make a delivery.  The sushi itself is generally of a good quality but the atrocious service has made it that we will never order from Wasabi again.  We've switched to Takara and have had a much better experience overall.

c9kdJ0xV7vyuKnU-DZq56g.review_text: Reasonably priced, excellent food, extremely personal over-the-top service if you know how to behave.  My GF and I were only going to stop in for a very quick snack before dancing, but we wound up ordering lots of food and saki and having a lovely evening.  Since then, I've been back with other friends and had an equally delightful experience.  Definitely check it out.

clQ5_3BFDqnJaebdp6LcHA.review_text: What would you call a roll which had:  - mediocre fish  - unimaginative menu  - European-style service  - weird, hipster, d-bag customers  - high prices  I'd call it the Wasabi Bistro roll.

Q5HreYPR-t05Zb0jWMEudA.review_text: I live in the neighborhood and I'm a big fan of Wasabi Bistro.  First off, for some reason whenever you go there the restaurant always has a table open (shhhh... don't tell anyone).  That's quite a rarity in the Castro and awesome to know that there's always a seat available at a good, reliable sushi place.  Second, the staff is really nice and the service (when you're in the restaurant) is always great.  On multiple occasions, the staff have either sent our table free edamame or given us a free sample of sake if we're having trouble deciding.  And, just last week, I was in there with a friend.  We were so deep in our conversation that we didn't realize it was already 11:20pm and the restaurant had closed.  I really appreciated that the folks there didn't rush us out and seemed happy to accommodate to us. One last time, the Dragon Veggie roll is totally delicious and the salad dressing... I don't know what they put in it but, honestly, I can't get enough.  Yum, thanks Wasabi Bistro!

w2o8rsUA_NkNd5AbUDO3nw.review_text: Fabulous sushi. Everything was fresh and delicious.  We were served free edamame within minutes of  sitting down. Happy hour had just ended, but we were still allowed to order from the specials. Other than the sushi, the agadashi tofu was also excellent and a huge serving.  Ditto for the miso glazed eggplant. Free ice cream at the end of the meal. Very reasonably priced. Highly recommended!

tLJ2QhKP3u7QtwEdXxieTw.review_text: What a great place! The sushi is fantastic and the staff is exceptionally friendly. The Country Roll was so good! I can't wait to go back and try some more!!

Mxd_5caUtCBDZfRvmKscBQ.review_text: Good place, friendly staff and fresh tasty sushi. Thay have a good happy hour too

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: Thanks, but no thanks.  Food:  Chirashi was just ok.  Sorta skimpy on the fish.  Some of the fish was not quite as fresh as I would have liked.  The tempura was standard and somewhat unremarkable.  The miso soup was also standard and unremarkable.  Service: Very slow, no fault of the waiter, since he was the only one for the whole restaurant during lunch time.  Ambiance: Quite modern and club-esque.  Overall, I will probably not be returning to this place when there are so many other places to eat in the area.

FFQzJQz30-2u-56V-iuzXQ.review_text: If I had to pick a sushi/Japanese restaurant in the Castro district, it'd be Wasabi Bistro.   I pride myself in thinking that I'm somewhat of a sushi connoisseur, and in terms of taste, service, decor and price(not that this place is cheap, because it's definitely not).  Value wise, they have an excellent happy hour menu: $1 oysters, $5 tempura $4 gyozas, a real bang for your buck. Moreover, their happy hour starts at 11:30am, which is unheard of.  I recommend their 3pcs/ or 6pcs Omakase menu in order to enjoy the best and tastiest sushi they offer.  I HIGHLY recommend their seared walu sushi-succulent, tasty, buttery, orgy and heaven in your mouth awesomeness.  As of right now, I'm the "duke" of Osaka sushi, which is a far cry from what Wasabi Bistro is. It's just that the later is right across from my work and I rather not walk further.  I strongly recommend you to try this place. Great food, Assertive service and has a modern touch in its decor.  5 stars!

PKI6SjI2PXjRmYC-IppGyQ.review_text: Really good fresh sushi  The staff is friendly. Albert the manager and Sarah were great to come to our table and give us some suggestions.  The quality of the fresh catch was one of the best in the city. Prices were reasinable too and good Sake too.  I felt spoilt and may get used to it.

QGQ2hGEqb3fF6cC8Q2M50g.review_text: Nice Modern Design and ambiance but inexperienced service flubs and lackluster flavor in most dishes leaves room for improvement.   This review is primarily focused on the happy hour menu.  But I feel if the menu fails in the happy hour most likely does not improve later on.    If you want ambiance and want to talk, and are not focused on the food's taste this maybe a good place - it never seems terribly busy.   I love oysters and the $1 oyster happy hour special is what attracted me to try Wasabi Bistro.  I've been several times now - irresistibly drawn by the oyster appeal. The oysters are a nice size and taste ( drakes bay perhaps?) and it's served with a ginger green onion ponzu dressing.  The dressing is ok but I'd prefer  a traditional mignonette with shallots and champagne vinegar.  I wish they offered the option of more than one accompaniment.  I tried their house hot sake - a lil rough...   One very good thing is their California roll made with very nice real & tasty snow-crab crab-meat.. I was pleasantly surprised and would come back just for the California roll.    I decided to try some other appetizers on the menu - the fried chicken - Chicken Karaage and Tempura.  These were mediocre, not soggy but not tastyeither.  I think this place has room for improvement.  I love meat , especially fried chicken but I think this dish would be improved if the chicken were more bite-sized and the if the dish received a sprinkle of seasalt before service.  The Tempura was not as crisp as it should be and was rather flavorless.. this place should take a page out of Osaka Sushi's playbook up the street..  The service is strange here .. a mixture of attentiveness coupled with periods where you are ignored.  I think this awkward service is due to an inexperienced & untrained staff.. out of the 4 times I've been here my order has always somehow been messed up.  Once the sake I ordered failed to arrive until halfway through my dinner.  Another time the 12 oysters I ordered never came until I brought it to the attention of the staff.  Another time they removed my entree thinking I was done without asking me.  I will go back in the next month and see how things improve..  hope they are still around and get better.

C4ZMX7p7lUL5za6ok7Yo_w.review_text: I was very pleasantly surprised by this sushi spot.  The fish was very fresh, the rolls were delicious and the sashimi was amazing.  I highly recommend the fresh oyster.

LWHO0aXIX_ZHi773jyOUZw.review_text: Came to Wasabi Bistro the first week of opening and the service was still getting up to speed so it wasn't all that great. However when I made a trip here again, it seems like the manager has done a better job at managing the service and I had a pleasant dining experience with a couple of my friends. The shrimp and scallops from the kitchen are wonderful and the fish is all fresh. I will definitely be back again.

Y6IiPVI6amY3oA-Ir9UM0g.review_text: Love this place! Great food and good service! The happy hour is great and can't beat the price and quality, give it a try

IH1iOatR3UkGxuiZVD4Xqg.review_text: Seasons closed along with its next door establishment, which was a low-end Chinese place for mostly take-out. These places are now combined into space called Wasabi Bistro. The large windows in the front are great for both diners and passerbys.  The first time I went, I got the chirashi, my favorite sushi dish. Basically a bunch of sashimi over a bowl of rice. The sushi was all fresh and the sushi rice was tasty. As was the ginger and wasabi. Absent in the dish were pickles, though some spicy sprouts were there. The dish was $14, which is about on par with the other places in the area. I ordered miso soup, which did not come with the lunch special (it should.) The miso was good.  However, on another visit, I got the sushi nigiri combo. One of the snapper pieces was completely inedible. Chewy, scaley, unfresh tasting. Really so terrible that I have never gone back since. I have eaten a lot of sushi in my life and have never been served something that terrible.  Takara remains my favorite choice in the area.

TrbwKmTpndbBmKimehlX9g.review_text: A friend had invited me to dinner here and I was pleasantly surprised since I don't venture into this part of town often, but now I don't mind making the trek over for Wasabi Bistro.   They use fresh ingredients and you can tell they put a lot of attention in every aspect of their food, from quality and preparation, to presentation. I've tried something new each time and every dish has been impressive. My favorite has been the uni served on a spoon, gyutan izakaya, and baby lobster tail sushi. Their sashimi omakase is always fresh and in season.  Great place to grab dinner and drinks with friends. Tip: Ask for the fresh wasabi, it brings out a different taste compared to the regular paste and not all places have it.

hu7UAMONehtlpfnnBfbogg.review_text: Decided to come here for my lunch break and made it in time for happy hour 11:30-6:30  Love the ambiance and the sleek look of the bar My server was Serena and she's pretty amazing! Customer service was on point, all the staff were friendly Choice of music was great!  I ordered a tempura for appetizer, calamari, unagi roll with a large sake on the side. No major complaints, will be coming back for a dinner date next time!  Check out this spot if your in the Castro area :)

6-AA014-IT2FJjcEqJBZYg.review_text: 19-October, Friday: I'll start this review with the bad points because this place is so inconsistent it is hard to place my finger on exactly why I feel so mixed, but basically here are my likes and dislikes.  CONS:  The interior feels like I stepped into the faux version of Donatella Versace's banquet hall: smelly alligator pleather upholstered on the booth seating, which is hugged by a long beveled wall of mirrors before it turns into an accent wall of more alligator pleather in the back with a flatscreen hung in the center. In the front room there are 2 dangly chandeliers that are quite ridiculously over the top, and a harsh transition to slated walls that were either made of mock-porcelain, or something resin coasted with a low-sheen to it.   -tuna poke: maybe a bit too much onion - rainbow roll: was frighteningly awful, the salmon and tuna tasted a bit rough in texture and the level of freshness was definitely questionable.   PROS: Despite the atrocity of overwhelming decadence that is the interior, the service is always friendly, prompt, overly polite, and overly apologetic. Both times I've been here they have been very proactive about taking orders too soon, without giving me time to first breathe while I am still perusing the menu in an effort to make the best of informed decisions.  However, in the same breath plates of pickled ginger, wasabi, and edamame immediately come out upon seating, along with tall tumblers of iced water.  --miso: fresh bits of tofu very firm, light on the sodium, and perfect for the cold weather. -spider roll: was nice and crisp -gyoza: were cooked very well and had with the perfect amount of seared crisp -walu nigiri: I was rather impressed with the excellent freshness, texture, and taste. -castro roll: had a subtle severity to it, as the slices of fresh jalapenos complimented the sweet sauce really well  MAS-O-MENOS: so-so -spring rolls: were descent  -hamachi nigiri: I've had much better  I would probably come back here exclusively for the things I had good experiences with, since this place is conveniently located to where I live. And there aren't much better options in the Castro.

Mm-HY6wMPyOJw1c_EUGrBw.review_text: Amazingly fresh and excellent service. The uni and toro are among the best in the city. They never seize to disappoint me. Owners are also very interactive and they will always "ganbei" with you

2su1nko0lzvQmmTGd8uBbw.review_text: The food is good but the service was a bit slow.  This is are second time here and we really like the golden eye and the salmon and tuna tartare.  This time we also got the volcano roll which is our new favorite.

danyTP8bG7gU6fm1bGhk2A.review_text: I've eaten here twice so far and I was happy (and full) both times.  I like how they removed the take-out section in the front.  Having the picture windows in the front of the restaurant are great.  It feels like you are sitting outside without having to deal with the outside noise and uncomfortable weather during cold periods.    My wife and I like to be surprised so many times we just ask the owner or manager for their best recommendations at that time.  Many times it's different because they will give us something that is fresh or in season.  There were a couple of times I asked for one of my typical sushi dishes and he would recommend something better.   It's kind of a team effort thing that we really aopreciate.  The food was great!  I like how creative some of their dishes are.  I don't really remember the names of the dishes because I just told the owner (Albert) to hook me up with some of the best stuff he can offer.  He did not disappoint us.  I just remember having various sushi and grilled dishes that I never had before and walked out of there totally stuffed and happy.  He actually comp'd me with a couple of dishes that were new and asked my opinion before adding it to the menu.  I did take photos of what I liked though so all I have to do is pull it up on my iPad and I'll get to re-experience the yummy dish I had before!    As Arnie S. would say ... "I'LL BE BAACK!"  :)  P.S.  They are the sister restaurant to Wasabi and Ginger on Van Ness and Vallejo streets.  Their food and service are very good too.  One of the things I like there is that they have FREE valet parking!

TkToy_vQXQmseminhFS8tw.review_text: Very fresh deluxe sashimi that came with great fresh cuts of a great variety of fishes.  Well worth the price!  The rainbow roll was also excellent!  Sat at the bar, service was friendly.  Fresh wasabi came with the deluxe sashimi.  Will go back.

plmzSOdhkz7CZRTQ6EVdGA.review_text: Great Sushi and Sashami. I'm always looking for excellent quality Sashami and have found it here. Good service, nice ambiance and enjoyable Sake. I recommend coming here for a meal with 1 friend or several. I've been here for lunch and dinner and it's always the best.

4CtoDM8il03xdcWPx11aQw.review_text: I ordered the pork ramen and it was delivered cold and no noodles.  Haven't been back and won't go back.  Between my experience and a mile long list of horror stories from friends we'd much rather go elsewhere.

__05rytNjsye9MBhqB0DMA.review_text: After a leisurely day, my friends and I dined here for our first dinner of 2013.   We shared several plates and rolls.   Ordered were the beef robata, smoked salmon, akimo (monk liver fish), chicken karaage (not on menu), chicken teriyaki, pink lady roll, and several other rolls that I cannot remember.      Most of the food was OK in taste except for the pink lady roll.  The roll is served with some odd sauce over the salmon layer.   The sauce was not to my liking.    Service was slow that evening, though it wasn't really crowded. I would say it was a little over half capacity.  Our server though was very good, as she was attentive to what we ordered.  She provided an extra large salad and 4 miso soups for our (at the time) 1 plate order. And she also corrected the chicken karaage portion size, as she noticed they brought out an appetizer portion.

JC99U5y-KAchZIjBhf_DiQ.review_text: Food is good, but the price is HIGH.  I think you can find comparable sushi places in SF without paying this steep price. The amaebi (sweet shrimp) was really good, and the heads were fried perfectly.  Uni was uber fresh. Godzilla Roll (recommendation) had multiple layers and had a nice level of heat.

Q9OtX03w24Q5Rz0JuzgjRQ.review_text: HIGHLY recommend!!!  A combination of freshness and the variety of foods, plus  excellent of services just make you can't wait to go back.  And best of all, it's very reasonable prices.  I extremely like the assortment of sashimi,  very very fresh!!!!!!

6Cy6d_NvjwpHBcNWgQdX3Q.review_text: You got to try this place. I was there the other day and ordered combo sashimi. Fish is fresh and unique. Chef's special sushi roll is very tasty.  Fried ice cream desert is yummy. The atmosphere is quiet and romantic.. I will go there with my friends again.

Ji7HfxXWCIPDmojkaEXjtw.review_text: This is one of my favorite sushi joints in Castro.  Some of the freshest sashimi and sushi with great presentation too.  Gotta love the ambience which is complimented by great customer service. Five stars!

M4lq0s_MynRpQAhYbuMulg.review_text: Went out on a suggestion to Castro and I will have to say that I did enjoy myself. We got hungry after a few beverages and decided to give Wasabi Bistro a try. I must say that it was pretty delicious. I love getting fresh sushi and rolls with good combos. Usually when I dont know exactly how a place will taste i order very slowly and simple things. As I get the food try it and like it, i'll go ahead and get riskier. I ordered:  Warm Saki and a large Sapporo- to get us started =]   Gyoza- Simple nothing out of the ordinary  Spicy Tuna- Was pretty good, was lacking spice but I just asked for a side of spicy mayo  Age Tofu- Very good. I love tofu so I was happy even with the amount!   Scallops wrapped in bacon- They were good but nothing from what they were... The bacon over powered them a bit  Godzilla Roll- fried miso tuna topped with spicy crab  In conclusion very good, great service and would definitely return

QT4FXurz3-7lKwrEfcbJEw.review_text: I've been here almost 10 times. It's open late. No attitude. Their sushi is the best in the Castro. I It wouldn't compare with the awesome sushi outside of this neighborhood however.  But the waitstaff is friendly and fast enough, including the manager who tries to greet everyone in a genuine way. It's big so there's usually no waiting.  I used to love Tokyo A GoGo and one of their sushi chefs works here. That's a good sign. And they give you a little bowl of edamame on the house. The decor is whacky which makes it feel unpretentious. And it looks pretty spotless.

wfHb6cGSSweF6XZYXw1XQA.review_text: Awesome!!!  Great happy hour sushi rolls. Fish is really fresh and flavored are solid.

9xeH3DClbtijEFBZjqd6eg.review_text: Wellllllll. My girlfriend and I went in for lunch the other day and were pretty disappointed. Our California roll came out hot. It also had a Piece of plastic in it that I almost swallowed. One of the other rolls tastes literally like dirt and the sashimi just wasn't fresh. We are going to stick with sushi time down the street. Maybe the dinner is better?

ecWHyrQNu-S5HEfFSGRbyA.review_text: Food was good, fish tasted fresh.  Nothing to complain about.

LWBaJtqpqgVl4ylzv-DmDA.review_text: Just amazing! Service, ambiance, food... Simply wow in my opinion!!! Definitely a must to try :)

tW6Znr0qZcrE9epALShffg.review_text: I've now eaten here twice now, both times being amongst the best dining experiences of all time. Their sashimi is the freshest and the best cuts. The spicy tuna I had the night before last has left me for a hankering I will have to satisfy during each successive visit.  The help is exemplary. I left a rare 25% tip after my last visit. This restaurant is under new ownership and extensively remodeled. The place is now truly beautiful and most accommodating. It is in the same location as another sushi place that I frequented for many years. As much as I liked the previous establishment, there really is no comparison.  Do yourselves a huge favor and head out for the Wasabi Bistro for your next night out to eat!

okrKhL4uuC54elaaOB5oXg.review_text: I really like their sashimi, is really really fresh, and rolls are good too! I will come bak!

ycAyKJt9PMIEv1ydETDpEQ.review_text: This place looks a lot nicer since they burned it down and got rid of that nasty Chinese takeaway that took up the shop front window. Now you have a nice big open space.  Only now all the walls are hard surfaces so the place is an echo chamber, making it impossible to hold a conversation without yelling at your partner.  And why does every restaurant in the Castro have to pretend to be a sports bar. Enough with the flat screens! I get they're cheap crowd-pleasers but go to The Mix if you want to watch the game.  And now for the main point. Service. Have these guys ever run a restaurant before? I ordered Tuna Sashimi, Salmon Sashimi and Agedashi Tofu and a glass of Sauvignon Blanc and my friend ordered California Rolls and a bottle of Sapporo. Nothing came as planned. Asahi Black came instead of Sapporo, while that was being sent back a random red wine came for me. Ok, with the drinks straightened out the food trickles in. "Special Sashimi" - a selection of 5 different fish came. sorry not ours. Then some rolls that looked like green hockey pucks (going with the sports theme?) came. Sent those back too. Then the Special Sashimi came back again. No takers? Then nothing for 20 minutes, our waiter studiously avoiding our stares.  We gave up at this point so I can't review the food. When we told the waiter we want to leave he just sighed and said "I'll bring the check".   Yet another disappointing restaurant experiment in the Castro.

nT3tLANzGy0a7DuB_GIQjA.review_text: Came in here for the happy hour with my boyfriend, and we got a dozen HH $1 oysters and the nigiri sampler. They brought out some free edemame and we munched on that while we waited for our food. The nigiri came out first; I think they let one of the apprentices cut the fish because some of the cuts were crooked. Not the prettiest sushi, but I guess you get what you pay for. The oysters were decent. Overall, not a bad happy hour, but nothing to go out of your way for.

HTD8SOsALckYWUmtAYA5Hw.review_text: My first time here and it's was such a great a experience. The fish was extremely fresh and my steak was delicious.  Sake was so mmmmmmm good. Albert the manager came by and said hi and he was more than happy to see us first timers here. The presentation of the food was amazing and I'm definitely coming back for sure. Happy birthday Joey!!!! ;-). Did I mention the fish was very fresh ;-)

brV0EwTAqFaDwn1fqP8hgw.review_text: When asked which of their fish were caught "sustainably", our server emphatically (and very confidently) responded "all of them".  To follow up, we asked if they served blue fin tuna, and our server proceeded "oh YES, and it's delicious!".    If you know anything about seafood sustainability, you know that the blue fin tuna industry is among the most egregious of all fisheries. Google it, and boycott this restaurant.  96% of the world's Blue Fin Tuna are gone already, and a full 90% of what's left are got before they have a chance to reproduce.     If you'd like your children to eat fish, boycott this and other restaurants like it.  If you're interested in learning more about the state of the worlds fish species, go visit the Monterey Bay Aquarium, which is at the forefront of knowledge on the topic.  PS. the food was great, the service good, and the prices reasonable for what you got.  If it weren't for this total disregard for the environment this place would have gotten 4 stars.
